contentHtml:
Generate Parentheses

You are given nnn pairs of parentheses and must return all combinations of well-formed parentheses.

  • n=3n = 3n=3
  • ["((()))","(()())","(())()","()(())","()()()"]["((()))", "(()())", "(())()", "()(())", "()()()"]["((()))","(()())","(())()","()(())","()()()"]

How to Solve?

Every open parenthesis "(""(""(" needs to have a corresponding closing parenthesis ")"")"")".

  • Meaning we cannot have more closed parentheses than open parentheses.

  • And our total open and closed parentheses must also not exceed nnn.

What kind of solution does this hint at?

Stack

We have to use a stackstackstack as our data structure, but we should also recursively backtrack.

Since we are tracking how many open and closed parentheses we have, shouldn't we set them to a variable?

Below, I will set my variables. resresres represents the array of strings of valid parentheses.

We will use a stack sss to append or pop from the stack. The variables ooo represent openopenopen and ccc represents closedclosedclosed parentheses.

  • s=[]s = []s=[]
  • o=0o = 0o=0
  • c=0c = 0c=0
  • res=[]res = []res=[]
  • o<no < no<n
    • Max of nnn open and closed parentheses.
  • c<oc < oc<o
    • Closed parentheses must be less than open.
oc
10
s
"(""(""("
  • First iteration:
    • o=1o = 1o=1
    • c=0c = 0c=0
oc
20
s
"(""(""("
"(""(""("
  • Second iteration:
    • o=2o = 2o=2
    • c=0c = 0c=0
oc
21
s
"(""(""("
"(""(""("
")"")"")"
  • Third iteration:
    • o=2o = 2o=2
    • c=1c = 1c=1
oc
22
s
"(""(""("
"(""(""("
")"")"")"
")"")"")"
  • Fourth iteration:
    • o=2o = 2o=2
    • c=2c = 2c=2
      • o==c==no == c == no==c==n
  • Valid Solution:
    • res=["(())"]res = ["(())"]res=["(())"]
  • Backtrack!
    • We still need to use s.pop()s.pop()s.pop()
oc
21
s
"(""(""("
"(""(""("
")"")"")"
  • Pop ")"")"")"
    • Most recent recursive call.
oc
20
s
"(""(""("
"(""(""("
  • Pop ")"")"")"
    • Most recent recursive call.
oc
10
s
"(""(""("
  • Pop "(""(""("
    • Most recent recursive call.
  • But waitwaitwait, we can't stop here. The second ififif statement means we need to continue to make recursive calls.
  • So we must continue by appending ")"")"")", because c<oc < oc<o
oc
11
s
"(""(""("
")"")"")"
  • Fifth iteration:
    • o=1o = 1o=1
    • c=1c = 1c=1
oc
21
s
"(""(""("
")"")"")"
"(""(""("
  • Fifth iteration:
    • o=2o = 2o=2
    • c=1c = 1c=1
oc
22
s
"(""(""("
")"")"")"
")"")"")"
")"")"")"
  • Fifth iteration:
    • o=2o = 2o=2
    • c=2c = 2c=2
      • o==c==no == c == no==c==n
  • Valid Solution:
    • res=["(())","()()"]res = ["(())", "()()"]res=["(())","()()"]

Therefore, you must return the result. We have all valid strings.

Helpful Hints

  • How to append to a stack?
    • s.append()s.append()s.append()
  • How to pop from a stack?
    • s.pop()s.pop()s.pop()
  • How do I visualize backtracking?
    • Through a decision tree.
      • Remember you can add either "(""(""(" or add ")"")"")" but make sure it follows the constraints.

Stack Solution

class Solution:
    def generateParenthesis(self, n: int) -> List[str]:
        # Set an empty stack
        s = []
        # Set the result list of strings
        res = []
        # Set o to 0
        o = 0
        # Set c to 0
        c = 0

        # Backtracking or DFS algorithm
        def dfs(o, c):
            # Check if o == c == n:
            if o == c == n:
                res.append("".join(s))
                return
            
            # If open is less than n
            if o < n:
                # Add "(" to the stack
                s.append("(")
                # Call DFS, add 1 to o
                dfs(o + 1, c)
                # After DFS executes, backtrack
                s.pop()
            
            # If closed is less than open
            if c < o:
                # Add ")" to the stack
                s.append(")")
                # Call DFS, add 1 to c
                dfs(o, c + 1)
                # After DFS executes, backtrack
                s.pop()

        
        # Call the DFS algorithm
        dfs(o, c)

        return res
title: Generate Parentheses
